contentrichtext.text: {{Other places}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Gostyń | image_flag = | image_shield = POL Gostyń COA.svg | image_skyline = Gostyń ratusz 1.JPG | image_caption = Town hall | pushpin_map = Poland | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Greater Poland Voivodeship|Greater Poland]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Powiat|County]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Gostyń County]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Gmina]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Gmina Gostyń]] | area_total_km2 = 10.79 | population_as_of = 2006 | population_total = 20588 | population_density_km2 = auto | latd = 51 | latm = 52 | lats = 45 | latNS = N | longd = 17 | longm = 0 | longs = 45 | longEW = E | elevation_m = 90 | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 63–800 | website = http://www.gostyn.pl/ }} '''Gostyń''' {{IPAc-pl|'|g|o|s|t|y|ń}} is a town in [[Greater Poland Voivodeship]] (from 1975 to 1998 in [[Leszno Voivodship]]), in [[Gostyń County]]. According to 30 June 2004 data its population was 20,746. The total area of Gostyń is 10.79 km². The town comprises 1% of the area of the county and 8% of the commune, according to [[Główny Urząd Statystyczny]]. ==History== ===World War II=== During the Nazi German [[occupation of Poland]] Gostyń became the site of public executions and deportation actions. On October 21, 1939 some 30 citizens of the town whose names were listed in the ''Sonderfahndungsbuch Polen'' ([[Special Prosecution Book-Poland]]) prepared by local German minority, were executed by an Einsatzkommando. Mass deportations began on December 4, 1939, with up to 2,000 Poles deported to [[General Government]] on the orders of SS-Standartenführer [[Ernst Damzog]] stationing in [[Poznań]]. Between spring of 1940 and March 15, 1941 additional 3,222 were deported.<ref name="muzeum.gostyn">{{cite web | url=http://www.muzeum.gostyn.pl/i/dg/229.pdf | title=Pierwsze wysiedlenia Gostynian do Generalnego Gubernatorstwa – 8 grudnia 1939 roku | publisher=Muzeum.Gostyn.pl | work=Expulsions of Poles | accessdate=June 20, 2012 | author=Robert Czub}}</ref> ==Demographics== Data for 31 December 2003: {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 0 0 1em 1em; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaaaaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; text-align:right;" ! !Total !% !Female !% !Male !% |-- |Population |20,929 |100 |10 886 |52 |10 043 |48 |-- |employed |6 630 |32 |3 103 |15 |3 527 |17 |-- |population density<br>(persons/km²) |1939 |  |990 |  |913 |  |} Data for 30 June 2004: {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 0 0 1em 1em; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaaaaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; text-align:right;" ! !colspan=2|Total !% !Female !% !Male !% |-- |population |20,746 |↓ |100 |10 798 |52 |9 948 |48 |-- |population density<br>(persons/km²) |1922 |  |  |  |  |  |  |} ==Gallery== <gallery> File:Gostyń fara 1.JPG|St. Margaret's Church File:Gostyń rynek 2.JPG|Main square File:Centrum Gostyn.jpg|The town centre </gallery> {{Commons category|Gostyń}} ==References== {{Reflist}} * [http://www.um.gostyn.pl/ UM.Gostyn.pl in Polish, English, and German] * [http://www.gostyn24.pl/ Gostyn at ''Gostyn24.pl''] * [http://www.wirtualnygostyn.pl/ Gostyn Virtual Tour at ''Wirtualnygostyn.pl''] {{Coord|51|53|N|17|01|E|display=title}} {{Gostyń County}} {{Gmina Gostyń}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gostyn}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Greater Poland Voivodeship]] [[Category:Gostyń County]]
